Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Teachable \Teach"a*ble\, a. Capable of being taught; apt to learn; also, willing to receive instruction; docile. [1913 Webster]
We ought to bring our minds free, unbiased, and teachable, to learn our religion from the Word of God. --I. Watts. [1913 Webster]
teachable adj : ready and willing to be taught; "docile pupils eager for instruction"; "teachable youngsters" [syn: {docile}]
